Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as a form of censorship that could lead to totalitarianism.
Censorship is viewed as a tool for dictators to silence dissent and control public opinion.
The redefinition of freedom by collectivists is criticized, arguing that it undermines individual liberties.
The essay draws parallels between historical examples of censorship and current events, suggesting that similar patterns are emerging.
The author argues that the concept of the 'common good' is often used to justify authoritarian measures.
Main Themes: Criticism of the concept of the 'common good'
Notable Quotes: The first order of business of totalitarians is censorship, so their anti-freedom program goes unchallenged.
A program of widespread censorship is the creation and work of a dictator.
The basic human right to decide what goes into your body is now being reversed.
